news.title: Infopark’s Irumpanam campus would be mixed township model: Kerala CM
news.para: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan announced that Infopark's upcoming Phase IV campus in Irumpanam will be a mixed township model, featuring five million square feet of new IT space. This development is expected to create 50,000 direct IT jobs and attract Rs 3,000 crore in direct investments, bolstering Kochi's industrial prominence.

news.title: Developers to act as urban infrastructure administrators in major city overhauls under UCF
news.para: The government is launching the Urban Challenge Fund (UCF) with a Rs 1 lakh crore outlay, allowing private developers to act as "urban infrastructure administrators" in redevelopment zones. This initiative aims to improve civic infrastructure by enabling private entities to develop and maintain essential services like roads and water supply, with financial support from the Centre, bonds, loans, and states.

news.title: Owners in a fix as Secunderabad cantonment board hikes property tax by over 100%
news.para: Secunderabad Cantonment Board property owners face a property tax increase exceeding 100%, a hike residents deem unprecedented. This comes amid fears of property loss due to a proposed road widening project, exacerbating financial anxieties for owners and tenants.

news.title: Orissa HC directs arrest of promoters for violating CRZ norms in Puri
news.para: In a significant move to protect the environment, the Orissa High Court has ordered the arrest of promoters for a major project in Puri. The court acted after the promoters allegedly violated coastal regulatory zone norms and continued construction despite submitting an undertaking to halt all activity.

news.title: Dream homes for 348 Neemuch families this Diwali: Madhya Pradesh CM
news.para: Chief Minister Mohan Yadav highlighted the joy of homeownership as 348 families in Neemuch celebrate Diwali in new houses. This initiative under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana fulfills a dream for many. Over 49 lakh families in Madhya Pradesh have already benefited. Neemuch will also get a medical college and air connectivity. Development of Bhadwa Mata temple is also planned.

news.title: Registration for e-auction of DDA plots from October 27
news.para: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) is launching an e-auction for nearly 100 plots across prime city locations, with registration opening on October 27. The auction will feature residential, institutional, commercial, industrial, CNG, and group housing plots. This initiative offers a significant investment opportunity in sought-after areas.

news.title: Ulhasnagar civic body appeals citizens to verify building legality before purchase
news.para: Ulhasnagar Municipal Corporation is urging citizens to verify building legality before buying property to prevent fraud and curb illegal constructions. Buyers must check for proper permissions and occupancy certificates with the Town Planning Department. The UMC will not be responsible for losses incurred from unauthorized structures facing demolition, aiming for transparency and protecting residents from unscrupulous developers.

news.title: Gumla administration resolves 746 land dispute cases
news.para: Gumla administration resolved numerous land disputes and other pending issues for underprivileged residents during its Anchal Diwas initiative. This program, aimed at improving grassroots governance, successfully settled decade-long land conflicts and facilitated the issuance of crucial certificates, bringing relief to many ahead of Diwali.

news.title: West Bengal CM asks councillors to ensure high-rise have proper drainage facilities
news.para: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee directed Kolkata Municipal Corporation councillors to ensure high-rise buildings have adequate drainage systems. This directive follows a recent deluge that inundated city structures. Relief operations are ongoing in North Bengal for flood victims. Jobs were provided to families of those who died from electrocution.

news.title: Signature Global raises ₹875 crore via debentures to reduce debt, expand business
news.para: Signature Global has secured Rs 875 crore via non-convertible debentures. This funding will be used to clear existing debt and fuel business expansion.  It aims for significant sales bookings this financial year.

news.title: Maharashtra clears Pune civic body's draft development plan for merged areas
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation's draft development plan for merged areas has been cleared by the state government. This plan, declared nearly eight years ago, now invites public suggestions for 60 days. The development plan will apply to nine villages, with a projected population of eight lakh by 2035. This aims to plan future facilities for these growing urban areas.

news.title: Bombay HC slaps contempt show-cause notice on doctor who suppressed facts to claim SRA tenement
news.para: Bombay High Court issued a contempt notice to a doctor for suppressing facts while claiming a rehabilitation tenement. The court found she illegally occupied over 2,200 sq ft and used structures as residence, clinic, and school, dismissing her petition with Rs 5 lakh costs. Authorities were directed to re-examine slum scheme verification processes.

news.title: Ahmedabad’s biggest land deal sets stamp duty record of ₹31 crore
news.para: Ahmedabad witnessed its largest land deal as LuLu International Shopping Malls Pvt Ltd acquired a 66,168 sq m plot in Chandkheda for Rs 519.41 crore. This landmark transaction generated a record Rs 31 crore in stamp duty for the government.

news.title: HC summons Uttarkashi DM over illegal construction in eco-sensitive zone
news.para: The Uttarakhand High Court has taken a firm stance, summoning officials from Uttarkashi district in response to a petition that raises alarms over unauthorized hotel and resort projects in the Bhagirathi Eco-Sensitive Zone. These constructions purportedly breach regulations set by the National Green Tribunal, prompting the court to request a detailed compliance report.

news.title: Encroachment of lands acquired for Rajasthan Housing Board 'absolute rank scam': SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has declared the encroachment of land acquired for the Rajasthan Housing Board a major scam. JThe court criticized attempts to regularize illegal constructions on housing board land. The Rajasthan government was allowed to withdraw its plea and approach the High Court for relief.

news.title: DDA to open flat registrations for 48-storey high rise residential society in East Delhi
news.para: Registration is now open for DDA's new residential project, DDA Towering Heights. This 48-storey building in Karkardooma offers 1,026 premium two-bedroom-hall-kitchen apartments. Prices range from Rs 1.78 crore to Rs 3.09 crore. The project is set for handover by July 2026. It boasts excellent connectivity and is part of a major urban development.

news.title: India Cements logs profit of ₹8.81 crore in Q2 FY26; to invest ₹2,014 crore on expansion
news.para: India Cements Ltd, now part of Aditya Birla Group, posted a net profit of Rs 8.81 crore for the September quarter of FY26. The company's board approved a significant Rs 2,014 crore investment. This includes Rs 1,574 crore for modernization and Rs 440 crore for capacity expansion. Revenue from operations saw a 9.31 percent increase.

news.title: UT chief secretary reviews functioning of Chandigarh housing board
news.para: Chandigarh Housing Board (CHB) reviewed operational efficiency and accountability under UT Chief Secretary H Rajesh Prasad. The board was directed to develop innovative housing schemes, boost public awareness for Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban) 2.0, and install solar panels on CHB flats to align with the city's development and solar city vision.

news.title: Orient Electric's net profit rises 15.52% in Q2 FY26
news.para: Orient Electric, a CKA Birla Group company, announced a 15.52% rise in net consolidated profit for Q2 FY26, reaching ₹12.06 crore. Total income grew 6.14% to ₹705.11 crore. The company highlighted strong performance in its Lighting and Switchgear segments, which saw an 18.6% increase.

news.title: Sobha posts net profit of ₹72.52 crore in Q2 FY26
news.para: Sobha has announced strong financial results for the quarter ending September 30, 2025. The company's net profit after tax surged to ₹72.52 crore. Total income also saw a substantial rise of 52.22 percent. Sobha's managing director expressed confidence in future growth, citing a robust pipeline and stable demand.
